title: Trump favored over DeSantis for 2024 Republican nomination ahead of ex-president's first appearance in D.C. since leaving White House; Trump scheduled to give keynote speech at 'America First Agenda Summit'
text:
With Trump suggesting he will declare a 2024 candidacy, he is 10 points ahead of Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis in the latest PredictIt showing. Former Vice President Mike Pence, who is also a potential GOP contender, is far behind both men, with only a 5% chance of winning the party's presidential nomination. Pence spoke Tuesday morning in Washington to the National Conservative Student Conference, blasting "big tech, big media, big government [and] even big business" for advancing what he called a "pernicious woke agenda."

On a week featuring both a Federal Reserve interest-rate decision and important data on the U.S. economy, Trump is scheduled to speak at the America First Agenda Summit, a program of the America First Policy Institute. That non-profit organization is headed by Brooke Rollins, who ran the Domestic Policy Council in the Trump White House. Former National Economic Council Director Larry Kudlow is vice-chair of the institute's board.

Trump has openly flirted with, but not declared, a 2024 campaign. Doing so would subject him to campaign-finance requirements. Trump's odds of winning the GOP nomination are currently at 44%, while the odds for DeSantis sit at 34%, according to PredictIt.

That's a reversal from a bit more than a month ago, when DeSantis's odds outstripped the former president's.

Read: Betting markets favor DeSantis over Trump for 2024 Republican presidential nomination, as Elon Musk voices support for Florida governor

The former president is scheduled to speak on Tuesday afternoon. The agenda doesn't preview what he will say, but Politico reported his allies are eager for him to lay out a game plan for 2024.

Fox News reported Trump is expected to focus on law and order in his speech, with a source telling the network he sees the issue of public safety as a "central issue" in November's midterm elections and one of "great contrast" between his policies and Democrats.

Also read: Biden proposing $37 billion to fund police, fight crime

Trump will speak a day before the Fed's interest-rate decision, in which the central bank is expected to raise rates by 0.75 percentage points. On Thursday, the government will report second-quarter gross domestic product, and Friday will bring inflation data for June.

As MarketWatch has reported, Republicans are widely expected to score wins in this November's midterm elections, thanks in large part to Americans' frustrations with raging inflation. The Biden White House, meanwhile, has downplayed the risk of a U.S. recession, with Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen pointing to healthy hiring as evidence.

U.S. stocks SPX edged lower Tuesday, hurt by Walmart Inc. WMT cutting profit guidance ahead of a wave of corporate earnings reports this week, while the International Monetary Fund warned of the potential for a sharp global slowdown.
